hackathon-judges.judge-role: Technology Fellow, Meltwater Entrepreneurial School of Technology

hackathon-eligibility: Anyone with an open mind who is willing to harness their unique experiences and talents to solve some of the world's biggest challenges! Join us as an individual or with a small team! Please register to be a part of this event.
hackathon-requirements: Create a business model, a project idea, a mobile app, a phsycial product - SHOW US WHAT YOU GOT AND THINK BIG!
hackathon-rules: Respect one another and each other's property, dream big, don't cause trouble, follow directions, clean up after your self.

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: 1 year scholarship at Hub Accra + Admission to Global Hackathon in Seoul

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Hub Accra is the local partner for Hack for big choices we are very proud to have worked with them to execute the largest hackathon in Africa. A dynamic organization,  their focus is to promote entrepreneurship by engineering an environment for coworking, innovation and acceleration of early stage entrepreneurship growth. Hub Accra’s sponsorship for the winning teams will include access to collaborative workspace, workshops, mentorship, inspiring events, business support services, and more.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: 1 year scholarship at Hub Accra + $300 in WP services

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Hub Accra is the local partner for Hack for big choices we are very proud to have worked with them to execute the largest hackathon in Africa. A dynamic organization,  their focus is to promote entrepreneurship by engineering an environment for coworking, innovation and acceleration of early stage entrepreneurship growth. Hub Accra’s sponsorship for the winning teams will include access to collaborative workspace, workshops, mentorship, inspiring events, business support services, and more.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: 1 year scholarship at Hub Accra + Free MYBALSAMIQ

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How innovative, new, or creative is the Application, Website or Service? Is it better than other solutions?
Will the Application, Website or Service meaningfully impact the lives of many people within the Target Population?

How scalable is the Application, Website or Service? What percentage of the Target Population can the Application, Website or Service be made to reach? Localized or local content, and multilingual support are key sub-criteria.

If it is not already, how soon can the Application, Website or Service be made available publicly (beyond limited trials and prototypes)? If the Application, Website, or Service is already publicly available, how stable and consistent is its performance?
Do you think they have a clear view of what’s going to happen next?
How the project can be sustained? Is the business model based on third parties?
Multidisciplinary factor is key. Is the team well organized with diversified and defined roles?

hackathon-description-header: DO IT YOUR WAY! pick a challenge. build a team. start a business. make an impact.
